Headline: 138 domestic, nine international flights cancelled at Delhi airport due to Pak escalation after 'Operation Sindoor'
Summary: The 129 flights cancelled included 66 domestic flights meant to depart from and 63 domestic flights that were scheduled to arrive at the IGI Airport. Of the nine international flights disrupted, five were departures and four were arrivals at the Delhi airport.

Headline: Market Slips As Indo-Pak Border Tensions Escalate| All Eyes On MEA Briefing| Closing Bell Live
Summary: Markets remained under pressure as border tensions simmer, with investors awaiting more clarity ahead of the MEA briefing at 5:30 PM. The Nifty hovered around the 24,000 mark, reflecting broad-based weakness, though midcaps were off their lows. The NSE advance-decline ratio stood at 1:3, while the VIX continued to surge, jumping another 3%. Banks were the big drags amid the overall weakness, while defence and shipbuilding stocks gained.

Headline: Cautious Confidence: Why investors should temper optimism and stay selective
Summary: Market reactions have typically been swift but short-lived, followed by strong recoveries once the scope of the conflict became clearer and appeared contained. The more important and lasting impact on markets is how the underlying stocks fare—and there is no reason to be either pessimistic or overly optimistic on that count, as equity valuations today are neither cheap nor expensive.

Headline: Smallcap, midcap indices tumble up to 2% amid rising India-Pak tensions: MCX, RVNL, Suzlon Energy shares drop up to 5%
Summary: "Heightened border tensions and weak global cues dragged down markets and the rupee. Headline: Markets Poised For Friday Meltdown Amid Indo-Pak Flare-Up| Opening Bell Live
Summary: GIFT Nifty hints at a 200-point gap down as Indo-Pak tensions simmer. Trump announced that a breakthrough deal has been reached with the UK. While details are yet to be finalized, Trump stated that a 10% baseline tariff will remain on the UK. He added that US negotiators expect to have a “good weekend” with China as opening trade talks begin. Wall Street ended higher following the UK trade deal announcement. US futures are flat after the rally on the US-UK trade deal. European stocks closed higher, but the UK’s FTSE 100 fell. The US 10-year yield climbed more than 11 basis points to 4.39%, and the USD index rose back above 100. Gold fell over 1% after Trump’s UK trade deal announcement, while oil prices rose 3% supported by renewed US-China trade hopes. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Raja Venkatraman, Co-Founder NeoTrader & Trading Influencer, Anand K Rathi, Co-Founder, MIRA Money and Sunil Subramaniam, Market Expert.

Headline: Closing Bell: Nifty at around 24,000, Sensex down 880 pts amid rising Indo-Pak tensions
Summary: BSE Midcap index ended flat, while smallcap index was down 0.3 percent. ICICI Bank, Power Grid Corp, UltraTech Cement, Shriram Finance, Grasim Industries were among major losers on the Nifty, while gainers were Titan Company, Tata Motors, L&T, Bharat Electronics, Hero MotoCorp. On the sectoral front, Realty index shed 2.3 percent, private bank index was down 1.3 percent, while media, consumer durables, capital goods, PSU Bank indices rose between 0.9-1.6 percent.

Headline: Airlines urge early arrival as India tightens airport security amid Pakistan tensions
Summary: As part of the heightened safety measures the Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) has ordered that all passengers at all airports across the country will need to undergo secondary ladder point security check (LPSC) or pre-boarding check, senior government officials in the MoCA said.

Headline: Kishangarh, Bhuntar, Ludhiana added to list of airports closed by Indian government
Summary: The three new airport were added to the list of closed airports in the India including airports in Srinagar, Jammu, Leh, Chandigarh, Amritsar, Patiala, Bathinda, Halwara, Pathankot, Shimla, Gaggal, Dharamsala, Jaisalmer, Jodhpur, Bikaner, Mundra, Jamnagar, Rajkot, Porbandar, Kandla, Keshod, Bhuj, Gwalior and Hindon. Airports primarily used for military charters have also been included in the shutdown.

Headline: Trade setup for May 9: Top 15 things to know before the opening bell
Summary: According to experts, the underlying trend of the Nifty 50 is weak, with an elevated VIX and momentum indicators tilting downward. The index breached the 24,200 level intraday, and if this level is decisively broken in the upcoming session, the correction may extend toward the 24,000–23,850 range.

Headline: Indian government increases flight monitoring operations, orders airlines, airports to enhance security measures
Summary: The enhanced security steps ordered by BCAS include increased surveillance; strict on-ground monitoring of for operations of microlite aircraft, aero models, para glider, unmanned aerial systems (UAS), drones; deployment of additional security guards at aircraft; thorough scrutiny of PNR, passenger and cargo manifest.

Headline: L&T sees prospective order pipeline of Rs 19 trillion in FY2025-26, says CFO, eyes 10 percent order inflow growth in FY26

IIFCL's net profit up 39% YoY to Rs 2,165 crore; may come out with IPO soon, says MD Jaishankar
Summary: In FY25, the company’s net worth rose 15% on year to Rs 16,395 crore, up from Rs. 14,266 crore in FY24 and 59% higher than Rs 10,306 crore in FY20, signalling increasing capacity for IIFCL to lend more to infrastructure projects with higher exposure limits.

Headline: Promoter stakes hit record low across m-caps as DIIs tighten grip: MOSL note
Summary: The MOSL report adds that in the largecap space, promoter stakes have fallen to an all-time low of 47.6% (down 160 bps YoY), while in the midcap space, it is now at the second-lowest level of 54.9% (down 130 bps YoY).

Headline: IndusInd Bank’s CD yields 10-15 bps higher in secondary market amid uncertainty
Summary: According to the Clearing Corporation of India (CCIL) data, traded yield on the IndusInd Bank CDs were in the range of 6.52 percent to 6.95 percent, as compared to 5.89-6.95 percent for private peers, and 5.70-6.70 percent for PSU banks.

Headline: Tariff cuts on UK’s whiskies may serve as template for the proposed India-EU FTA
Summary: The EU has been pushing India for greater access for their wines, which currently face a 150 percent tariff. Through the FTA with UK, India has agreed to halve duties on whiskies to 75 percent, which will be lowered to 40 percent in 10 years.

Headline: Pakistan's stock market valuation just a fraction that of India; Sensex returns better than KSE-100 in most recent years

Headline: India's major housing markets see price plateauing after flat quarters
Summary: Average prices in Bengaluru rose to Rs 7,881 per sq ft, while in Hyderabad, touched Rs 7,412 per sq ft. In contrast, key mature markets such as Delhi NCR, Mumbai Metropolitan Region, Pune and Chennai, recorded no quarterly change in prices, suggesting a plateauing of prices.

Headline: BEML, HAL, Paras Defence shares tumble up to 4% after India-Pakistan tensions escalate
Summary: The Indian government announced that Pakistan attempted strikes on Indian military installations using drones and missiles overnight. Indian Armed Forces then targeted air defence radars and systems at multiple locations inside Pakistan, and an air defence system positioned in Lahore was successfully neutralised.
